alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:18PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central St. Louis County through 245 PM CDT... At 217 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Embarrass, or 21 miles southeast of Lake Vermilion, moving southeast at 35 mph. Torrential rainfall was observed with this storm just west of Embarrass at around 215 PM CDT. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hoyt Lakes around 220 PM CDT. Aurora around 225 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Fairbanks and Whiteface Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters.
